result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 8, 2017 at 10:45 am.
to Extend DEOJ Agreement
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement on count one (diversion program)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:36 am 
INCLUDES 13CM1243, 13CM2388, 14CF172, 14CF318, AND 14CM412. 
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Def appears in person with Atty Keith Ellison. 

MOTION TO REVOKE DEOJ IN 13CM1243. 
State moves to revoked DEOJ and enter judgment. COURT enters judgment on Ct. 1 (Misd. Retail Theft). 

PLEA HEARING IN 13CM2388, 14CF172, 14CF318, AND 14CM412. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.

State moves to: 
In 13CM2388: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF172: Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF318: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 13CM2388: Ct. 1 (Misd. Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CF172: Ct. 1 (Felony Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CF318: Ct. 2 (Misd. Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CM412: Ct. 1 (Misd. Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty, and defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1 in 14CF172. 
Atty Ellison makes statement. 

SENTENCING IN ALL FILES. 
COURT ORDERS: In 14CF172: Ct. 1>>DEOJ for 2 years with conditions as outlined in written DEOJ agreement. 
State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ, it will move to dismiss that charge. 
Review of DEOJ set for December 16, 2016 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA. 
COURT ORDERS: On all 5 remaining counts (including Ct. 1 in 13CM1243)>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; AODA; $100 hours cs; Lettters of Apology to Walmart in Rib Mountain, Target in Weston, Quality Foods in Weston, Walgreens in Weston, and Pick N Save in Weston to be furnished by February 28, 2015; No contact with Target in Weston, Pick N Save in Weston, Walgreens in Weston, Walmart in Rib Mountain, and Quality Foods IGA in Weston; pay restitution as laid out in DEOJ agreement (joint and several with co-def); good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/schooling; payment fo court costs. 
COURT remits DNA surchages in 13CM1243 and 13CM2388. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 2 days jail credit in 14CF318 if revoked and NO days jail credit in the remaining files. 
COURT finds the def eligible to petition for expungement when she turns 27 if she successfully completes probation and DEOJ agreement. 

Adj: 10:08 am

ADDRESS INFO for Shelbie C. Mcnutt
Current: 5606 Hickory Street, Schofield, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 12-11-2014)
Prior: 3612 Sternberg Ave Apt 6, Schofield, WI 54476
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:03 am 
INCLUDES 13CM1243, 13CM2388, 14CF172, 14CF318, AND 14CM412. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person with Atty Keith Ellison. 

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 14CF318. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to schedule future dates. 
Bond:  Continued. 

Adj: 9:06 am
Pre-trial conference on August 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
w/attached letter
Review hearing on July 1, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 6, 2014 at 08:50 am.
Review hearing on April 16, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on May 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:24 pm  
INCLUDES 13CM1243, 13CM2388, 14CF172, AND 14CM412.  
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person with Atty Julie Sawyer. 
State notes date was set for Motion Hearing to revoke DEOJ in 13CM1243, but notes all matters are close to resolution and asks to proceed with waiver of preliminary hearing in 14CF172. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 14CF172. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea: Not Guilty. 
Court sets matters for calendar call on March 26, 2014 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA. 
Bond: Continued.
